title: ISic002737. Honorific for Lucius Iulius Agrippa, euergetes
body:
1L(ucio) · Iulio · C(aii) · f(ilio) · Agrippae
2euergetae ·
3hic · plateam · a · Sosia
4usque · ad · fanum ·

1L·IULIO·C·F·AGRIPPAE
2EUERGETAE·
3HIC·PLATEAM·A·SOSIA
4USQUE·AD·FANUM·

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text of I.Segesta, with the addition of interpunctuation on the basis of photograph

English translation

Jonathan Prag

To Lucius Iulius Agrippa, son of Gaius, euergetes. This man (was responsible for) the street from Sosia all the way to the temple

commentary

The stone is presumably a plaque to be affixed to a statue base, with the word 'hic' referring to the statue of the honorand. Euergetes is the first instance of this Greek word as a calque in Latin. 'a Sosia' presumably refers to a location within the city, and has been suggested to refer to a statue (Dubois), or perhaps a platea or via.

  • Tribulato 2012 314 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001557
  • Ampolo and Erdas 2019 L8 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001036
